title: good fps and ping but still constantly lagging
body:
I have a computer that can run Battlefield 1 on max settings and i get 100 mps download speed but for some reason when i play league i find that i'm constantly lagging behind. Even when i just go into a custom game on my own it seems like every other click my champion takes way to long to move and quit often jolts forward so i don't see the animation at all. So far I've just tried fiddling around with the setting but when i'm getting above 200 fps and 30 ping i don't see how that can be the problem. 

Any help from someone smarter than me would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

replies.body:
It sounds like you may be experiencing delays in-game caused by *Packet Loss* or tons of buffering! These sorts of issues are terribly annoying and are usually a result of specific network settings that conflict with League and cause issues between your PC and the servers. I strongly recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure all your local network settings are compatible with League.

Please let me know if you continue to experience issues after taking those steps.

I've done all the steps on the connection guide and im still having the same issue. I ran the Netalyzr to see if i was experiencing packet loss and it came up yelllow and said this *•We received unexpected and possibly dangerous results when looking up important names 
•Your web browser has a problem accessing IPv6 sites 
•Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic 
•The path between our system and your network does not appear to handle fragmented IPv6 traffic properly 
•Only some root servers returned DNSSEC information*
Since i don't know what any of this means i was hoping  you could take a look at it and tell me if this is the source of my problem before i contact my internet provider about it.

Thank you.

Those specific items on that Netalyzr test aren't too important regarding the issue you're experiencing, so I wouldn't worry about them right now. Since you're still seeing issues in-game, I'd recommend we run some traceroute logs to find the source of the issue. I recommend grabbing a free networking app called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete this. After loading up the app, plug **185.40.65.1** into the host field before starting the trace. After it's run for 5 minutes or longer, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you run into any issues with this.
